%md

# Start Hive project

%md

Provision the hadoop(v 2.9) cluster in GS data proc by clicking create a cluster.

%spark.sql

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS wdi_gs;

%md

1. Create the bucket in GS into the storage.
2. Go to link: https://bigquery.cloud.google.com/table/patents-public-data:worldbank_wdi.wdi_2016
3. Click export and get it exported to the target source as 
gs://gz-sumit-bootcamp/datasets/wdi_2016/wdi_2016.csv.gz

# pdf 1
.6 - Load GS Data to Hive External Table
Now create a new folder to store new data into local hdfs location rather than from using gs:// goolge storage

%sh

hdfs dfs -mkdir -p hdfs:///user/sumit_mistry_jrvs_ca/hive/wdi

%md

1. Create 1 more external hive table (wdi_gs_text)
2. Using INSERT query...copy data from `wdi_gs` (google storage gs://)----->   `wdi_csv_text` (hdfs location hdfs:///user/sumit_mistry_jrvs_ca/hive/)
3. Check hdfs fielsize now for the both `wdi_gs` and `wdi_csv_text`

%md

Hive check

%md

Compare Hive count speed vs Bash count speed...
Clear cache first-after one by ssh into all the worker nodes terminal and write below command..

msg.data:
Compare Hive count vs Bash count

Clear cache first-after one by ssh into all the worker nodes terminal and write below command

paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo 3 | sudo tee /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches

# pdf 1.10.1 - OpenCSV serde limitation:

It takes longer to process each line as it processes each line further step than regular serDe in hive.
OpenCSV converts all data types into string , Serde treates all columns as a string. To convert back columns into desired type you need to create a view in table and CAST to the desired type.

%spark.sql

DROP VIEW IF EXISTS wdi_opencsv_text_view

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql

CREATE VIEW IF NOT EXISTS wdi_opencsv_text_view 
AS
SELECT cast(year AS integer), countryName, countryCode, indicatorName, indicatorCode, cast(indicatorValue AS float)
FROM wdi_opencsv_text

paragraphs.text:
%md

# pdf 1.14- Find highest GDP GROWTH for EACH country

msg.data: Find highest GDP GROWTH for EACH country

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql

SELECT wdi_csv_parquet.indicatorvalue,  wdi_csv_parquet.year,  wdi_csv_parquet.countryName
FROM  (SELECT Max(indicatorValue) as indiVal, countryName
        FROM wdi_csv_parquet
        WHERE indicatorCode = 'NY.GDP.MKTP.KD.ZG'
        AND indicatorValue <> 0
        GROUP BY countryname) temp1
        
        INNER JOIN wdi_csv_parquet
                ON temp1.indiVal = wdi_csv_parquet.indicatorvalue
                    AND temp1.countryname = wdi_csv_parquet.countryname
%spark.sql
